title: CSS Borders
subject: CSS
learning_objectives: Learn border sides (top, right, bottom, left)
theory:
The CSS border properties allow you to specify the style, width, and color of an element's border.

*   `border-style`: Required. Specifies the kind of border (solid, dotted, dashed, double, etc.).
*   `border-width`: Width of the border (px, em, thick, thin).
*   `border-color`: Color of the border.
*   `border-radius`: Adds rounded corners.
*   `border`: Shorthand property.

examples.output: A box with a 2px black outline and rounded corners.

common_mistakes.correction: `border-style` is mandatory. If not set, the border won't appear.

interview_questions.question: How do you create a circle using CSS borders?
interview_questions.answer: Set width and height to be equal (a square) and `border-radius: 50%`.

real_world_use_cases.description: Form inputs use borders to define the typing area. Changing border color on focus indicates activity.

exam_notes: Order of shorthand: width style color.
summary: Borders define the edge of your elements and are crucial for separating content visually.
